extendedIngredients.name: canned tuna
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cans (6 oz. each) tuna, drained, flaked

title: Tortilla Tuna Wrap
summary: Tortilla Tuna Wrap is a pescatarian recipe with 4 servings. One portion of this dish contains roughly 42g of protein, 35g of fat, and a total of 733 calories. For $1.68 per serving, this recipe covers 36% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as an affordable main course. A mixture of tuna, pepper, real mayo mayonnaise, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the flour tortillas you could follow this main course with the Cinnamon Sugar Crisps as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 10 minutes. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 82%. This score is excellent. Similar recipes include Turkey Tortilla Wrap, Omelet Tortilla Wrap, and Wrap 'n Roll Tortilla.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 34 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot
productMatches.description:
Our 2006 Merlot isn't shy, with its deep, dark garnet hue and abounding aromas of rich black
cherry, cassis and clove. Approachable, integrated tannins frame the generous dark fruit
flavors and coat the palate with soft velvet. The long, fruity finish, laced with autumn spices,
ends with a lively cranberry zing. "This is a very classy wine from a gorgeous vintage. Take
that, Miles!" laughs Winemaker Tom Rinaldi, with a reference to the film Sideways.

instructions: Mix tuna, celery, mayo, red pepper and cheese.                                            Spread tortillas evenly with the tuna mixture.                                              Top each with 2 lettuce leaves; roll up.

steps.step: Mix tuna, celery, mayo, red pepper and cheese.
Spread tortillas evenly with the tuna mixture.
Top each with 2 lettuce leaves; roll up.
